title: Firefox extremely slow on Mac OS X
content:
Opening a new empty tab is very slowly with the spinning wheel (about 10 to 20 seconds). With no other tab opened. Closing a tab also takes about more than 10 seconds (empy tab, no other tab).

Can not open web sites : almost every times nothings happens. But sometimes it works. Firefox process has tenths of child processes which are <defunct>

What I have tried : - Remove all configurations files (see list below) - Install a fresh Firefox - Restarts the computer (MacBook Pro Intel) - Launch Firefox

That means that I have an empty profile, no external module, no account synchronisation, no history, no bookmarks, zilch, nada ...

Repeated the previous procedures several times the last few months. With : - Mac OS X Ventura 13.5.1, Firefox 117.0 and Firefox 119.0 - Max OS X Sonoma 14.1, Firefox 119.0.1 - Mac OS X Sonoma 14.1.1, Firefox 120.0 - Mac OS X Sonoma 14.2.1, Firefox 122.0

Firefox has a normal behaviour for a few days after each system upgrade. Then the problems comes back.

Other browsers (Chrome, Safari) works fine and smoothly.

But ! TorBrowser, which is built on Firefox, encounter the same problems.

Configurations files that I delete : - ~/Library/Preferences/org.mozilla.crashreporter.plist - ~/Library/Preferences/org.mozilla.firefox.plist - ~/Library/Caches/org.mozilla.firefox - ~/Library/Caches/org.mozilla.crashreporter - ~/Library/Caches/Firefox - ~/Library/Caches/Mozilla/updates/Applications/Firefox - ~/Library/Saved\ Application\ State/org.mozilla.firefox.savedState - ~/Library/Saved\ Application\ State/org.mozilla.updater.savedState - ~/Library/WebKit/org.mozilla.firefox - ~/Library/Application\ Support/Firefox - ~/Library/Application\ Support/Mozilla /Library/Application\ Support/Mozilla

Can not find anything to try.

Any idea ?
creator: olivier.marti

title: Why did places.sqlite file rewrite?
content:
My places.sqlite file deleted all previous history on Jan 17th at about 11:07 PM all the way back to early December of 2023. Ccleaner was last run on Jan 11th and the browser settings are set to clear cache and cookies only. The computer was showing no issues and I did not discover the lost history until I pulled up the history four days later. The history identified only the past four days when the last week was selected. The sessionstore-backups folder showed files back to January 1st. What I cannot figure out is why the places. sqlite would just clear on its own and why I cannot activate any previous sessionstore file by following the mozilla firefox instructions below.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/how-restore-browsing-session-backup

I only get the landing page with the option to restore the previous session grayed out. What common reasons are there for a places.sqlite file to wipe out a block of history and why would reactivate a previous session not work? Thanks!
creator: 2bgvnzh5nr

title: Updating Firefox failed
content:
I have a slight problem. I'm currently using Firefox 116.0.3 and it seems that it can't update. The automatic updating will run, and then it will fail (this is all the time when using Firefox). It will recommend me to download the newest version from the website, but then the CDN will and I will be presented with the "connection was reset" error. This happens both on my Windows 10 and Windows 11 machines. Both are running Firefox 116.0.3.

Funnily enough I tried to see if I could download the newest version on Edge (Chromium), which it could but the version I got from the website was the same version I have now. I wonder if this is something to do with my region as I'm based in China and I'm aware that some software can have...problems.

Also, when trying to download version 122.0, it is fantastically slow and will often fail to complete.

Is there anything that could be suggested as I really don't want to use Edge.

title: Perdí todas mis pestañas abiertas en el mozilla
content: Buenos días, Siempre tengo abiertas muchas tabs en el mozilla al mismo tiempo y a la vez tengo activada la función del menú "preferencias", que dice "open previous windows and tabs". El día de ayer, inicié como todos los días mi sesión en el computador, abrí el mozilla, estuve trabajando un tiempo y por error presioné el ícomo de home, que se encuentra en la parte superior izquierda del mozilla. Inmediatamente el mozilla, comenzó a cargar a la vez, todas las páginas que yo tenía abiertas, pero luego me dí cuenta de que realmente no me abrió las mismas páginas que yo tenía abiertas, sino otras que había abierto tiempo atrás (Meses antes). Me preocupé y pensé que desactivando la opción de "open previous windows and tabs", evitaría que al reabrir el mozila se me cargaran nuevamente las páginas erradas (viejas), entonces desactivé esa opción y cerré el programa. Ahora, ya no encuentro en ninguna parte las tabs que tenía abiertas antes de cometer ese error de presionar el ícono de home y tampoco me funciona restaurar sesión previa. He perdido un año de investigaciones que tenía abiertas en las pestañas del firefox y he intentado de muchas maneras que he visto en videos en internet y ninguna funciona, porque al parecer, solo está la copia de seguridad que firefox hizo cuando cerré por última vez el programa (Que por error contenía páginas que eran muy viejas y yo no deseaba abrir). Espero me puedan colaborar. Muchas gracias.
creator: alejpv

title: Infusionsoft, Cloudflare: Access Denied
content:
For the past few months I have been unable to access a lot of sites...I click a link in a newsletter or email, and get a message that I have been blocked. It's happening more and more, and it's very frustrating...I used to have no problem. I have not done anything unusual, changed my VPN or anything. I clear the cache and cookies every so often. No idea why this is happening. Is there a fix, please? Thanks!

Here's one example: (I do not have anything listed below on my computer, nor have I disabled cookies.)

Firefox


80 Fri Jan 19 21:37

Access Denied Error 15 secure.aarp.org 2024-01-20 07:37:12 UTC What happened? This request was blocked by our security service Your IP: 66.8.175.172 Proxy IP: 45.60.152.55 (ID 10258-100) Incident ID: 258001270323700279-430942583112474565 As you were browsing something about your browser made us think that you were a bot. There are few reasons this might happen: • You were a power user moving through this web-site with a super-human speed. • You have disabled cookies on your browser. • A third-party browser Privacy or Script OR Cookie-Blocker plugins OR Extensions OR Open/SSL/Free-Malicious VPN OR Imposter Browser Plugins -- such as Ghostery, Privacy Badger, ExpressVPN, Click&Clean, Malwarebytes Browser Guard, Block Origin, Blur, DuckDuckGo Privacy Essentials, Unshorten.link, NoScript, Duck-Duck-Go, Guardian and Others is preventing Javascript from running. To regain access make sure that the cookies and javascript are enabled before loading the page. Powered by imperva awakennealer.mos
